name: Type R Subsidized Merchant
description:
The Type R Subsidized Merchant (colloquially: the Fat Trader) is an increased-payload mixed passenger and car- go trader with Jump-1 drives. Local governments subsidize the shipâ€™s expenses to encourage service to specific routes.

The Subsidized Merchant (Far Trader) is designed as a clean cargo platform of 200 tons with bow and stern loading doors. Landing Skids restrict the ship to tarmac (or bedrock) landings. Typical landing procedure is to glide approach the landing area, slow to a near stop, and settle on Landing Skids.
